text: anyone know of any good drawing tools on Linux for brainstorming geometry type problems? Most of the ones I know are super tedious so I end up using Pencil + Paper but that's sloppy and doesn't have good version control...

elements.text: anyone know of any good drawing tools on Linux for brainstorming geometry type problems? Most of the ones I know are super tedious so I end up using Pencil + Paper but that's sloppy and doesn't have good version control...

text: like drawing with B-splines and stuff or more like drawing on a touchscreen with a digital pen?

elements.text: like drawing with B-splines and stuff or more like drawing on a touchscreen with a digital pen?

text: Tikz

elements.text: Tikz

text:
Seriously I need alternatives to Tikz.
I don't write papers anymore so my latex skills are no longer on point.
Compose.jl and Luxor are ok.

With a GUI, I would pay money for MS-Visio, except it doesn't work on Linux or Mac.
They have a office 365 version that maybe I should try.

<http://Draw.io|Draw.io> (or is it <http://Diagrams.net|Diagrams.net> now?) is ok.

elements.text:

Diagrams.net
now?) is ok.

It seems it's homebrew formula is broken

text: I prefer luxor to compose's syntax, but I'd prefer to free my brain from exact point locations. So inkscape and <http://draw.io|draw.io> look nice. <http://Draw.io|Draw.io> has actually improved a lot since I last looked at it. Few years ago it was kind of sketchy...
